result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J Benson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Invade Privacy - Use Surveillance Device, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 942.08(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must sign up for probation within 72 hours.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt. Corrected on 3-11-2016 to add.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.  Thinking For Change class will be up to probation agent.  Must participate in a Restorative Justice program that may include the victim if probation agent wishes.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua J Benson in court with attorney Laura Ann Sutton.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant pleads guilty. 
State asks for 30 days jail, imposed and stayed with Huber and good time.
1 year probation 
Sex offender evaluation if deemed appropriate by probation.  
Court finds guilty and orders:  Sentence withheld.  Probation for 1 year with conditions to include any other evaluations or assessments recommended by probation.  Thinking For Change class will be up to probation.
Must participate in a restorative justice program/conference that may include the victim(s) if PO wishes. 100 hours community service.   Must sign up for probation within 72 hours.  Must pay court related costs including DNA.  60 days to pay.  DNA to be submitted on Thursday, March 10, 2016.

Defendant Joshua J Benson in court with attorney Laura Ann Sutton.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Reset.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Joshua J Benson in court with attorney Laura Ann Sutton.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
No agreement;  Plea hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Attorney Fees - $100.00 per month by wage assignment beginning 01/01/2016 - Laura Sutton
